original: Ahlborn, Erik Gunnar, docent, lektor, Göteborg, f. 10/3/03 i Sthlm av tuWkontr. Erik A. o. Gerda Horngren. — Stud:ex. v. Norra latin i Sthlm 21, fil. kand. i Upps. 24, fil. mag. 25, fil. lic. 32, fil. dr i Gbg 46, stud. v. univ. i Caen 21-22, Grenoble 26-27 o. 29-30, Göttingen o. Bonn 23, Cambridge o. London 24, Perugia 27, Zaragoza 27, Santander 34, fransk stud:ex. del I 22, dipl. di abilitazione airinsegna-mento deli-a lingua italiana alFestero 27, provår v. Vasa h. a. 1. i Gbg 45. Timlär, o. ämne-slär. i Sigtuna 31-32, sv. lektor v. univ. i Paris 32-40, lektor i franska v. Gbgs högsk. 42-45, timlär. o. ämneslär. v. Gbgs h. samsk. 42, doc. i romanska språk v. Gbgs högsk. 46, lektor v. Hvitfeldtska h. a. 1. i Gbg 46. Skr.: Om ’Stud. i Frankr. (tills. m. G. Kjellberg 35), Om akad. stud. o. univ. i Frankr. (i Univ. i en ny värld, utg. av M. Allwood 44), Le patois de Ruffieu-en Vairomey (46).
translated: Ahlborn, Erik Gunnar, associate professor, lecturer, Gothenburg, b. March 10, 1903 in Stockholm to parents Erik A. and Gerda Horngren. He graduated from Norra Latin High School in Stockholm in 1921, received a Bachelor of Arts degree from Uppsala University in 1924, a Master of Arts degree in 1925, a Licentiate degree in 1932, and a Doctorate in Philosophy from Gothenburg in 1946. He also studied at the universities of Caen, Grenoble, Göttingen, Bonn, Cambridge, London, Perugia, Zaragoza, and Santander. In addition, he earned a French Study Certificate in 1922, and a Diploma of Ability to Teach Italian as a Foreign Language in 1927. He served as a part-time teacher and subject teacher in Sigtuna from 1931-1932, a Swedish lecturer at the University of Paris from 1932-1940, a lecturer in French at Gothenburg University from 1942-1945, a part-time teacher and subject teacher at Gothenburg High School from 1942, an associate professor in Romance Languages at Gothenburg University from 1946, and a lecturer at Hvitfeldtska High School in Gothenburg from 1946. His writings include "Stud. i Frankr." (with G. Kjellberg 1935), "Om akad. stud. o. univ. i Frankr." (in "Univ. i en ny värld," edited by M. Allwood, 1944), and "Le patois de Ruffieu-en Vairomey" (1946).

structured.name: Erik Gunnar Ahlborn
structured.description: Erik Gunnar Ahlborn was a Swedish associate professor, lecturer, and expert in Romance languages. He was born on March 10, 1903, in Stockholm to parents Erik A. and Gerda Horngren. Ahlborn received his bachelor's, master's, and licentiate degrees from Uppsala University, and his doctorate in philosophy from Gothenburg University. He also studied at various universities around Europe and earned a French Study Certificate and a Diploma of Ability to Teach Italian as a Foreign Language. Ahlborn worked as a part-time teacher and subject teacher in Sigtuna, a Swedish lecturer at the University of Paris, a lecturer in French at Gothenburg University, a part-time teacher and subject teacher at Gothenburg High School, an associate professor in Romance Languages at Gothenburg University, and a lecturer at Hvitfeldtska High School. He wrote several works, including a study on French university students and a paper on the dialect of Ruffieu-en-Vairomey.
